item.Name: object uses only own static lightmap
search cardinal direction lightmaps on failure
extension of parent#object uses parent's markers
object is always on the ceiling
sample enviroment lighting only ignore object lighting
effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
does not collide with camera#force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide
force collide with camera#force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide
damage not blocked by obstructions#AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.
grab parent object in forge editing
never use imposter for shadow generation

_field_real.name: bounding radius#If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.
dynamic light sphere radius#sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

_field_real_point_3d.name: dynamic light sphere offset#only used if radius not 0

_field_explanation.name: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

_field_tag_reference.name: melee sound#this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

_field_real.name: self-destruct time:seconds#if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

_field_string_id.name: ai type name#used for combat dialogue, etc.
interaction name#if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object (NYI - you can use any)

item.Name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
mapping does not controls active#the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound
random time offset#function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1
always exports value#when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value
turn off with uses magnitude#the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

_field_string_id.name: import name#if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
ranged interpolation name#if you have the ranged button checked

_field_real.name: min value#function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

_field_block.name: interpolation

item.Name: fractional#covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

_field_real.name: linear travel time:s#used by constant velocity

_field_block._field_explanation: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

_field_real.name: spring k#used by damped spring determines acceleration by displacement
spring c#used by damped spring determines damping based on velocity
fraction:0-1#used by fractional how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

_field_long_integer.name: runtime interpolator to object function mapping*!

_field_real_bounds.name: selection bounds#if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

item.Name: update state animation and keyframe rigid bodies every frame

_field_tag_reference.name: type^
_field_tag_reference.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

item.Name: force always on#when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string
effect size scale from object scale
works on land#drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

_field_string_id.name: variant name#if empty, may be used by any model variant

item.Name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

_field_block.name: multiplayer object
_field_block._field_explanation: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in
Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

_field_block.name: falloff function#Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

_field_block._field_explanation: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here
These are default shaders used for boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for spherical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for cylindrical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for box boundary geometry

_field_tag_reference.name: simulation_interpolation#Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

_field_block.name: spawn effects
_field_block._field_explanation: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

_field_tag_reference.name: multiplayer spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in MP games
survival spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games
campaign spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

item.Name: use ground scale for all unspecified attachments
fixup position upon detaching from parent
fixup position after attaching to parent

plugin._field_explanation: everything you need to display shite
because grenades look better as coconuts. 0==1

_field_tag_reference.name: grounded friction settings#If not present, the default from global.globals is used.
Tossed Override# Used to override the object tossed when item owner is killed. Is overridden by tossed weapon override.

_field_real.name: energy recovery time:seconds#after deactivation, energy stays constant for this long before starting to change by 'inactive energy rate'

item.Name: never dropped by ai#if an actor dies while carrying this, it gets deleted immediately does not affect dropping by players
can not be picked up by player
is removed from world on deactivation#used with supercombine attach

_field_string_id.name: unit stow marker name#the marker on the unit to attach this equipment to when it is stowed. The equipment should have a marker named "equipment_stow_anchor"

item.Name: automatic if empty#picks it up automatically, if you have no equipment in your inventory, otherwise, press RB to swap
always automatic#always picks it up, whether or not you have another piece of equipment
manual#press RB to pickup or swap this equipment
activate on ground#Never pickup, press RB to activate it in-place

_field_real_argb_color.name: forced primary change color#sets the primary change color on the unit to this if the flag above is checked
forced secondary change color#sets the secondary change color on the unit to this if the flag above is checked

plugin._field_explanation: Settings which the AI use to know how they should react to this equipment

_field_real.name: danger radius#How large a danger zone we should create around this equipment (0 means no danger zone)
min deployment distance:wus#How far does my target have to be for me to throw this at them?
awareness time:seconds#How long I should go unnoticed by nearby enemies

_field_string_id.name: ai dialogue equipment type#The equipment ability type name used by the ai dialog system used to filter equipment activation dialogue events.

item.Name: hides player-unit from camera#the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

use aiming vector instead of marker forward#for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

_field_angle.name: look acceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking
look deceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

_field_real_fraction.name: look acc smoothing fraction#if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

_field_angle.name: override fov#if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

_field_real_fraction.name: cylinder fraction#controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

_field_angle.name: obstruction test angle:degrees#how wide of a cone to test

_field_real.name: obstruction max inward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision
obstruction max outward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current
obstruction max velocity:1.0/s#maximum speed the camera can move
obstruction return delay:s#when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

maximum camera velocity:wu/s#how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_block.name: abilities

_field_real.name: duration:seconds#use negative numbers for infinite duration
warmup time:seconds#time before the equipment truly becomes active

cooldown time:seconds#for equipment that suppresses combat actions, these actions remain suppressed for this long after the equipment deactivates Note that if this equipment also readies weapons when deactivated, the weapon will not be usable until both this timer expires and the ready animation has finished, whichever is longer
phantom volume activation time#time in seconds for the phantom volumes on this object to start accelerating things in them

_field_block._field_explanation: All these fields are additive, meaning a negative number will reduce energy and a positive one will increase energy. Every piece of equipment starts at 1.0 energy

_field_real.name: minimum activation energy#energy must be at least this high to activate Like activation cost, but doesn't actually change energy levels
low energy warning threshold#used by UI

item.Name: cannot be active while airborne#if checked, this equipment cannot be activated if the user is airborne, and deactivates itself if the user becomes airborne
cannot activate while airborne#can't activate in midair, but doesn't turn off if you later become airborne
cannot activate while standing on biped#if you are standing on another biped you can not use this equipment
cannot be active in vehicle#can't be activated in a seat, and deactivates if a vehicle is entered
cannot be active while motion is modified by physics#e.g. by mancannon
suppresses hero-assist-equipment use while active#probably this means sprint
activation anim suppresses weapons and melee
readies weapon on deactivation#note - if this equipment has an animation cycle, the weapon is readied after the exit animation finishes. Otherwise the weapon-ready happens immediately on deactivation
hides weapon on activation#checking this flag will automatically cause the weapon to ready on deactivation
Cannot activate in vehicle#cannot activate while in vehicle, but previously activated equipment remains active
ignore auto-pick-up weapons while active#Prevents auto-pick-up of weapons set to auto by megalo action weapon_set_picup_priority
suppresses weapon zoom during activation animation#the equipment only suppresses zoom during its activation animation
suppresses jumping during activation animation#only suppresses jumping during its activation animation
suppresses vehicle entry during activation animation#only suppresses vehicle entry during its activation animation
suppresses grenade usage during activation animation#only suppresses grenade usage during its activation animation
Hide reticule during during weapon ready
Deactivating during warmup will apply deactivation energy penalty
Deactivating during warmup will fire deactivation effects
Ignores normal support weapon force deactivation of equipment#used by Auto Turret to bypass how support weapons force equipment deactivation
toggle#toggles state when X is pressed
hold#activates when X is pressed and deactivates when X is released
double tap#activates when X is pressed twice in quick succession
shield fail#activates when player shield fails

_field_char_integer.name: object noise adjustment#for AI perception. while active, adjusts noises made by the owner unit by this many 'notches'. note that this is additive, so a positive number is louder and a negative number is quieter

_field_real.name: spawn radius#distance from players eyeball on the z-plane that this effect spawns
spawn z offset#z-offset of effect spawn
spawn area radius#need a sphere of radius r's free space in order to spawn, otherwise we pick a new spawn location
spawn radius#distance from players eyeball on the z-plane that this effect spawns
spawn z offset#z-offset of effect spawn
spawn area radius#need a sphere of radius r's free space in order to spawn, otherwise we pick a new spawn location
arm time#time before it becomes a proximity mine
self destruct time#seconds after it is created that it must self destruct. 0 means never destroy
trigger time#seconds object moving at trigger velocity takes to trigger explosion. This will smooth out sensitivity to velocity noise
trigger velocity#WU/sec at which we trigger explosion
arm time#time before it starts making noise
noise radius#radius in WU that the noise extends to.

_field_long_integer.name: noise count#number of noise points that are generated

_field_real.name: flash radius#radius in WU that the damage flash noise extends to.
shield recharge rate:1.0f/s#while active, shields recharge at this fraction per second
shield max recharge level#highest level shield can recharge to (can be up to 4)

_field_string_id.name: loop-invincibility shield name#active while the equipment is in use (used for shield rendering effects)
post-invincibility shield name#active once the equipment is no longer in use

_field_struct.name: post-invincibility time to shield level function

_field_real.name: maximum vertical velocity:WU/SEC#we use this to specify the domain of the active vertical velocity funtion

_field_block.name: threshold effects#the effect with the highest threshold will play on deactivation

_field_real.name: threshold energy burned^:0-1#how much energy you have to burn to play this effect
energy adjustment:-1 to 1#how much energy to add when playing this effect

_field_block.name: vitality traits

wheelman armor vehicle recharge time modifier
wheelman armor vehicle emp disabled time modifier

_field_block._field_explanation: Any damage taken is divided by this number. If you put -1, that means "invulnerable".

_field_real.name: explosive damage resistance#incoming damage multiplied by (1 - resistance)
wheelman armor vehicle stun time modifier
wheelman armor vehicle recharge time modifier
wheelman armor vehicle emp disabled time modifier

hero equipment energy recharge delay modifier
hero equipment energy recharge rate modifier
equipment energy use recharge rate modifier
explosive area of effect radius modifier

_field_real.name: hero equipment energy use rate modifier
hero equipment energy recharge delay modifier
hero equipment energy recharge rate modifier
equipment energy use recharge rate modifier
explosive area of effect radius modifier

_field_char_enum.name: equipment usage excepting auto turret#false will disable all equipment except auto turret
weapons explode on death armormod#spawns projectile specified in globals.globals
weapons resourceful#grenade probabilities defined in grenade_list.game_globals_grenade_list

_field_block._field_explanation: Type any string from the relevant sections of multiplayer/globals.multiplayer_object_type_list.

explosive area of effect radius modifier

weapons explode on death armormod#spawns projectile specified in globals.globals
weapons resourceful#grenade probabilities defined in grenade_list.game_globals_grenade_list

_field_block.name: appearance traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's appearance

_field_block.name: appearance traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's appearance

_field_block.name: stasis field
_field_block._field_explanation: The effective rate at which time passes for objects in the field. Values below 0.45 screw up jumping.

_field_real.name: max biped turning rate:no idea what units... something like .2 or so
gravity multiplier#negative values will invert gravity

_field_block.name: ball lightning
_field_block._field_explanation: Damage effect that passes from one biped to nearby bipeds, recursively

_field_real.name: chain radius reduction multiplier^:[0.01, 1]#MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO - each time lightning chains, this is the multiplier that controls how much the radius is reduced by

item.Name: shield vitality tied to energy#as energy goes down, the shield vitality will as well

_field_real.name: shield damage to energy scale#scale factor for energy gain from shield damage to child. Damage is normalized, so if this value is -1.0 then the equipment will lose all its energy when its child's shield is depleted.
starting warm up object scale#if >0 (and warm up time is >0), object size will scale up from this up to 1.0 over course of warm up time and down over cooldown time

_field_real_point_3d.name: offset from parent#the root of the child is offset by this amount from the root of the parent biped

_field_real.name: vertical offset in world space#used to adjust hight per biped, regardless of aim direction

_field_real_bounds.name: min and max pitch:degrees#the min and max pitch that the child will follow as you aim up and down. -90 to 90

_field_block.name: jet pack

item.Name: Use camera and movement for thrust dir#Jetpack thrust dir is controlled by camera dir and player movement (signifies Zero-G jet pack)
Cache thrust at activation#don't let the player change the direction of thrust once they activate

_field_struct.name: Infinite energy thrust to acceleration function

_field_real.name: negative velocity acceleration scale#when falling, scale the thrust by this (so you can 'catch' yourself easier)
grounded acceleration magnitude#how hard to kick you upwards if you activate while grounded
landing anticipation time:s#how many seconds before landing the jetpack user enters the airborne arc

_field_block._field_explanation: These apply if 'Use camera and movement for thrust dir' flag is checked

_field_real.name: camera vs move input thrust control#Camera direction (0.0) VS movement input (1.0) interpolation
min speed#drag will be applied above this
drag cutoff time#if 0, drag is always applied
cow catcher front width#world units, the width of the flat front portion of the cow-catcher
cow catcher side width#world units, the width of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher
cow catcher side depth#world units, the depth of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

_field_real_vector_3d.name: cow catcher offset#offset from the unit's origin to put the origin of the cow-catcher at

_field_tag_reference.name: collision damage override#if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, this can override the unit's collision damage definition during the teleport

_field_real.name: shimmer decrease rate:1.0/s#how fast shimmer decreases
shimmer bullet ping:0-1#how much to ping shimmer when hit by a bullet

_field_struct.name: shimmer to camo function#this is a periodic function with a period of 1 second the shimmer value is used as the range input (interpolates between green and red)

item.Name: driveable#hologram is automatically bump possessed by the player

_field_real.name: Danger Radius#AI avoidance radius. Ignored if zero.
Speed multiplier#Use this instead of a trait. 0 defaults to 1. With a trait, the client will move at non-modified scale until it gets replicated.

_field_block.name: teleporter
_field_block._field_explanation: This causes you to warp forward. It'll trace the path with an effect at the specified speed, then spawn you at the end of it.

item.Name: hide unit during transit#during the teleport, hide the unit and turn off collision
disable shortened teleport#makes it so that we always thrust or teleport the full distance; not wise unless
disable extra probes#only the center probe is cast, no extra probes
force along aim vector#ignores all search vector parameters and uses the aim vector as the search vector
can pass through objects#only collides against environment and structures
force along stick direction#if stick throw magnitude==0 then search in facing direction, else search in stick direction

_field_real.name: travel speed#the speed at which you cross the teleporter distance; 0 means instant
deactivation speed#the speed you return to at the end of the teleport, if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked

_field_tag_reference.name: trace effect#an effect that will follow along the travel path

_field_real_vector_3d.name: trace effect offset#offset from the unit's origin to put the effects at

_field_real.name: max pitch (airborne)#[-90 to 90] the pitch of the search vector will be clamped to no higher than this when starting a teleport in the air
max pitch (ground)#[-90 to 90] the pitch of the search vector will be clamped to no higher than this when starting a teleport on the ground

_field_block._field_explanation: If "force along aim vector" isn't checked, the start vector will be your motion vector, plus some amount of weight for where you're looking, if you're moving along your look vector.

_field_real.name: look vector weight#value from 0 to 1 for how much we can use the look vector in place of the movement vector
look vector falloff inner#degrees, inside this angle, we use the look vector at full weight
look vector falloff outer#degrees, outside this angle, we only use the movement vector
move vector vertical offset#degrees, how much to offset the move vector vertically; positive is up, negative is down

_field_block._field_explanation: If "disable extra probes" isn't checked, we'll do a fan of rays vertically from our central vector, with one probe horizontally on either side of each of those rays.

_field_real.name: horizontal probe angle#degrees, the angle to each side of the horizontal probes
vertical probe angle#degrees, the angle up and down covered by the fan of vertical rays

_field_long_integer.name: number of vertical probes#higher is more likely to find a good match, but more expensive

_field_block._field_explanation: If "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, we'll add a cow-catcher collision volume on the front and change the collision damage type.

_field_real.name: cow catcher front width#world units, the width of the flat front portion of the cow-catcher
cow catcher side width#world units, the width of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher
cow catcher side depth#world units, the depth of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

_field_real_vector_3d.name: cow catcher offset#offset from the unit's origin to put the origin of the cow-catcher at

_field_tag_reference.name: collision damage override#if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, this can override the unit's collision damage definition during the teleport

item.Name: turret follows player#if set, turret follows player, otherwise it moves to a specific location
turret fake gravity#if set, turret will sink to a height defined in y orbit offset below

_field_real_point_3d.name: orbit offset from player#z forward, x right, y down. Set x,z zero to get independent turret, y is altitude off ground

_field_real.name: orbit range#if above are zeros, this is max turret range
maximum range#if not following player, maximum distance downrange turret will travel
turret halt engage time:seconds#amount of time after a moving turret engages a target before it halts movement
turret idle equipment drain multiplier:[0.1]#the multiplier on equipment drain when equipment is in its idle state
turret inactive equipment drain multiplier:[0.1]#the multiplier on equipment drain when equipment is in its inactive state
spawn radius:world units#area that must be clear in order for turret to spawn
spawn in time:seconds#the turret will be inactive for this duration

_field_real_vector_3d.name: spawn offset from player:world units#relative to origin and camera direction without pitch

_field_tag_reference.name: spawn effect#effect played on the turret when it is spawned into the world
collision phase effect#effect played on the turret while a biped or vehicle passes through it

item.Name: Apply tell damage response to friends

_field_real.name: maximum tell distance:wu#'Other activation tell effect' will be applied to players within this distance

_field_tag_reference.name: activation tell effect#applied to other players within maximum distance

_field_long_integer.name: motion sensor tell blip ticks#within 'maxiumum tell distance' blip duration if 'Generate tell motion sensor blip' is checked

_field_real.name: Lifetime #Number of seconds a projected shield will remain active.
Recharge Time #Number of seconds between shield projections.
Warmup Time #Number of seconds it takes to activate a projection.

_field_real_fraction.name: Max Move Percentage #Percentage of distance between current and desired positions a shield can be moved per update tick.

_field_real.name: Offset Amount #Distance from defender's position to project the shield.
Min Projection Distance #Minimum distance between defender and attacker required to project shield.
Max Projection Distance #Max distance from equipment that shield can be projected.

_field_real_fraction.name: Min Required Energy Level #Min energy required to activate shield.

_field_tag_reference.name: Project Effect #Beam effect that links equipment to projected shield.
Warmup Effect #Effect played at eventual shield projection point during warmup period.
Shield Crate #Crate created to represent projected shield.

_field_real_fraction.name: Chance to Collect #Percent chance (0-1) that collector has to collect each grenade. Will only attempt to collect each grenade once.

_field_real_bounds.name: Collect Cooldown #Number of seconds collector must wait between successful collections.
Attack Delay #Number of seconds collector must wait before throwing a collected projectile at a target.

_field_real.name: Max Collect Range# Max range in world units that collector can collect and hold onto projectiles.

_field_real_bounds.name: Orbit Radius# Collector will try to keep collected projectiles orbiting in this range.

_field_real.name: Orbit Speed# Speed at which collected projectiles orbit.
Vertical Offset# Orbit vertical offset amount.
Strength# Controls amount of acceleration applied to projectile.
Attack Speed# Initial speed of projectiles when thrown as an attack.

_field_tag_reference.name: Collect Effect #Beam effect that links equipment to each collected projectile.

_field_real.name: acceleration#this is a percentage of max velocity per second - 0.1 reaches max velocity in 10 seconds
decay rate#the rate at which a moving camera decays when you release the stick. Lower decays faster.

item.Name: ordnance ui#special version of RS use for ordnance droppod UI
target designator#target designator is in weapon field

_field_real.name: Base drain per second#Will be multiplied by a value from the drain level block.
Energy recovery delay#The targeted equipment will not start regenerating energy until at least this much time has gone by.
Cone angle degrees#Degrees away from the reticle at which targets are in the cone.
Cutoff distance#Targets within this distance will be affected by this multiplier.
Drain multiplier#Multiplied by the base drain per second.

_field_tag_reference.name: cone effect#an effect that will shoot out of your face
target effect#an effect that will play on the target
hologram spawner#reference the equipment that will spawn the hologram that will pilot the remote vehicle
vehicle#reference the remote vehicle to be created

_field_string_id.name: seat label^#hologram gets loaded into this seat in the vehicle
spawn position flag#position of scenerio flag with this name. Empty will default to flag named 'remote_vehicle_start_position'

item.Name: Pause shield stun timer#false forces full amount of stun following deactivation

_field_tag_reference.name: activation while disabled by player traits sound
Player sound bank#High quality player sound bank to be prefetched. Can be empty.

_field_real.name: Switch point#value of the function (between 0 and 1) where the sound is triggered

_field_long_integer.name: Mode#0 for triggering while function is decreasing, 1 for increasing (more modes to come?)
